;In the early morning of November 1, 2023, Kweichow Moutai (600519.SH) issued an announcement on major matters: decided after research , starting from November 1, 2023, the ex-factory price of the company's 53%vol Kweichow Moutai (Feitian, Five Star) will be increased, with an average increase of approximately 20%. This adjustment does not involve the market guidance price of the company's products.

;

;This is the first time in nearly six years that Kweichow Moutai has raised its ex-factory price since New Year’s Day 2018. The ex-factory price of Feitian Moutai, the core single product of Kweichow Moutai, will increase from the previous 969 yuan/bottle to about 1,169 yuan/bottle.

;

;This blockbuster news instantly detonated the wine circle. Many industry insiders told Southern Weekend reporters in the early morning of November 1 that they were a little shocked that Kweichow Moutai raised prices at this time, and it exceeded expectations.

;

;Spurred by news of the price increase, on November 1, Kweichow Moutai’s collective bidding opened 9.82% higher, with a transaction value of over 1.2 billion yuan. After the opening, Kweichow Moutai's share price pulled to 1,850 yuan/share from 1,684.58 yuan/share on the previous trading day, changing its recent slightly sluggish trend.

;

;;

;

;Starting from November 1, 2023, the ex-factory price of Feitian Moutai, Kweichow Moutai’s core single product, will increase from the previous 969 yuan/bottle to approximately 1,169 yuan/bottle. ;(Visual China/Picture);

;

;

;“I don’t care about the ex-factory price, but I care about whether the price of 1,499 yuan will increase.” After Moutai issued an announcement late at night, some Moutai consumers said so. On New Year's Day 2018, Kweichow Moutai announced that it would adjust the ex-factory price from 819 yuan/bottle to 969 yuan/bottle, and at the same time increase the market guide price from 1,299 yuan/bottle to 1,499 yuan/bottle.

;

;The announcement issued by Kweichow Moutai mentioned: This adjustment does not involve the market guidance price of the company's products. This price adjustment will have a certain impact on the company's operating results.

;

;On the morning of November 1, a reporter from Southern Weekend called the Kweichow Moutai Board Secretary Office as an investor. The relevant staff responded: "Our announcement is very clear. The adjustment this time is the ex-factory price, which is 1,499 yuan." The market guidance price has not changed."

;

;As to why the price was raised at this point in time, the above-mentioned staff member said: "Since we have not made price adjustments for nearly six years, we have fully considered the macroeconomic environment. , changes in market supply and demand and other factors, we insist on being market- and customer-centered, taking into account the long-term development of the enterprise, and adjusting the ex-factory price of products based on the long-term stability of the market. This is a normal and reasonable business behavior."

; < p>; According to incomplete statistics from Southern Weekend reporters, this is the eighth price adjustment for Kweichow Moutai since it was listed in 2001. Previous price adjustments were in 2001, 2003, 2006, 2008, 2010, 2012, 2018. The interval between this adjustment is the longest since Moutai was listed.

;

;Huo Dongjie, chairman of Hexi Investment, who has long studied Moutai, told Southern Weekend reporters: "Previous Moutai price increases usually occurred when the liquor cycle was on the rise, but recently the price of Feitian Moutai is higher than the same period in recent years. Weak, for example, historically, prices increased during the Mid-Autumn Festival, but this year they fell."

;

;Data provided by wine merchants at Bairong Market, the country's largest liquor wholesale market, show that on October 31, 2023, 53 The bulk Feitian price of %vol Kweichow Moutai is 2,650 yuan/bottle, and in late June 2023, the bulk Feitian price is 2,820 yuan/bottle.

;

; Therefore, many interviewees told Southern Weekend reporters that with this price increase, some dealers’ profits will be transferred to Moutai, and the main impact will be on the channel profits of dealers and wine merchants below dealers. .

;

;Wang Zhanfu, general manager of Zhengzhou Xiyun Industry, believes that the current core products of famous liquor brands except Moutai in the liquor market are seriously upside down. This price increase is not only the responsibility of the industry boss, but also the group's 2023 Effective release of growth pressure.

;

;“Dealer profits are huge profits for Puma, so this price adjustment will not have a big impact on dealers, not to mention that dealers will push up the circulation price. This is the strong brand tension of Kweichow Moutai. It’s decided, other brands don’t have it,” Wang Zhanfu told a reporter from Southern Weekend.

;

;As a senior wine merchant in Zhengzhou, Wang Zhanfu was also paying close attention to the circulation price of Feitian Moutai on the morning of November 1. However, as of press time of the Southern Weekend reporter, he said: "Currently wine merchants will most likely not ship. I'll take a look."

;

;Other interviewees said that this price increase means the improvement of Kweichow Moutai's efficiency and the redistribution of channel profits.

;

;From January to September 2023, Kweichow Moutai achieved operating income of 103.268 billion yuan, and the net profit attributable to shareholders of the listed company was 52.876 billion yuan. The price adjustment at this time means that the last two months of 2023 will bring more revenue and net profit to Moutai.

;

;Huo Dongjie told Southern Weekend reporters: "Our preliminary assessment is that this price adjustment will increase Kweichow Moutai's profit by 6% next year."

;

;According to estimates from Founder Securities, Moutai will leave the factory this time After the price increases by 20% from 969 yuan, the revenue in 2023 will increase by approximately 6.2 billion yuan, an increase of approximately 4.2%, and the net profit will increase by approximately 4.1 billion yuan, an increase of approximately 5.6%.

;

;Cai Xuefei, an expert in China’s wine industry think tank and general manager of Zhiqu Consulting, believes that this price increase will help boost confidence in the currently sluggish industry. Reasonable price increase expectations will also stimulate and drive related consumption growth, and at the same time echo long-term capital market needs.

;

;;Behind Moutai’s price increase;;;

;

;Many interviewees expressed that they were surprised by Moutai’s price increase. It was unexpected. After all, nearly six years have passed since the last time Kweichow Moutai raised prices. During this period, when Moutai will raise ex-factory prices has always been the focus of market attention. < /p>;

;In 2020, the liquor industry set off a wave of price increases, but Moutai did not follow up. At Kweichow Moutai's 2022 and first quarter performance briefings and the shareholders' meeting in June 2023, Moutai Chairman Ding Xiongjun also responded to the price increase issue many times. He once said that Moutai liquor must be determined in accordance with relevant laws and regulations such as the Price Law. The price will also consider factors such as supply and demand. "We will definitely follow the laws of the market and respond to market demand."

;

;A senior person in the liquor industry who did not want to be named told a Southern Weekend reporter: “Moutai’s special status and economic influence determine that Moutai’s price adjustments are extremely sensitive and often involve enterprises and governments. Waiting for opinions from many parties, and having a strict demonstration and confidentiality process."

;

;The person pointed out that the price increase was indeed sudden, but it was obviously intended to boost confidence. Another head of an investment institution who has invested in Moutai for more than 20 years told Southern Weekend reporters: "This price increase is part of the policy to protect the capital market."

;

;From the perspective of the company itself, In recent years, Kweichow Moutai has continuously increased the proportion of direct sales revenue by reducing the number of dealers, expanding direct sales channels, increasing directly-operated stores, and launching the iMoutai platform.

;

;Since 2017, the total number of Kweichow Moutai dealers has decreased from 3,083 to 2,082 as of the end of the third quarter of 2023. The reduction of thousands of dealers has led to the continued growth of Kweichow Moutai’s direct sales business. In 2022, Kweichow Moutai's direct sales business will account for 40%. In the first three quarters of 2023, Kweichow Moutai's direct sales revenue increased by 44.93% year-on-year, reaching 46.207 billion yuan, accounting for approximately 44.92% of total revenue.

;The Chengdu Science Fiction Museum, which will be built in 2023, will be held from October 18th to October 22nd. The main venue of the World Science Fiction Convention. ;(Photo courtesy of Chengdu Pidu District Science and Technology Innovation City Management Committee/Picture);

;

;The main venue of the 81st World Science Fiction Convention in 2023 ——Chengdu Science Fiction Museum is located in the center of a two-kilometer radius area called "Science Fiction Avenue". When Chengdu's bid to host the event was successful two years ago, it was still a wilderness. This plot of land in Pidu District, Chengdu, which was originally planned as a "Science and Technology Museum", was quickly upgraded to a "Science Fiction Museum".

;

;This science fiction pavilion designed by Zaha Hadid Architects continues its pursuit of curves and a sense of the future. In the jungle of horizontal and vertical straight lines in the suburbs, several artificially shaped curved surfaces are implanted. According to the official statement, it was a nebula from the universe, but science fiction writer Liu Cixin said that it also looked like an alien spacecraft that landed on the lakeside. Anyway, this is the World Science Fiction Convention and it needs a visual imagery.

;

;This is the first time that the World Science Fiction Convention has come to China. Initially, the World Science Fiction Convention was just a whim created by a few young people under the age of 20 in Chicago, USA - to create a gathering platform for science fiction fans around the world. In 1939, they held their first convention in Chicago. Through gatherings and autonomy of science fiction fans, people from all over the world who like a certain science fiction work gather together to chat about their reading experiences, exchange handicrafts, and commemorate the dead of science fiction... For eighty years, the World Science Fiction Convention has inherited such a loose and rich tradition The gene of imagination has grown a unique and lasting science fiction culture.

;

;Entering the Chengdu Science Fiction Museum through the huge dome-style entrance requires you to go through multiple security checks. The opening ceremony showed some common elements of a Chinese-style evening party - the host's high-pitched recitation, the colorful stage, and the group dances that filled the space. However, the organizers added as many science fiction elements as possible to highlight the conference's atmosphere. The theme is "The Era of Symbiosis".

;

;"China's science fiction fan culture has not had extensive exchanges with the culture I was exposed to when I grew up for decades. I still have many things to learn beyond my previous experience." Co-chairman of this conference Ben Yarrow said, "Of course, Chinese science fiction fans also have a lot to know about the culture of the World Science Fiction Convention."

;

;"Member Culture"

;

;Chengdu in late October The chill has already set in, and the summer vacation for students has passed early. When Chengdu applied to host the World Science Fiction Convention in 2021, many student science fiction fans spent money to register as members of the 79th Washington World Science Fiction Convention (approximately more than 600 yuan) to vote for Chengdu in order to see the science fiction event during the summer vacation.

;

;According to the "World Science Fiction Association Constitution", various memberships with different titles can be purchased. If you purchase the membership for the current year, you can vote for the city that will bid for the next two years, and you can also vote for the Hugo Award. Vote for the shortlisted works. This approach is similar to "crowdfunding". The vast majority of the budget of previous World Science Fiction Conventions comes from the purchase support of members.

;

;This is a unique membership culture among science fiction fans in the world. In the 1950s, soon after the Hugo Awards were established, fan awards were added. Science fiction fans who wrote their own works and amateur magazines could also stand on the podium of the Hugo Awards and compete with those "big names" The works complement each other. The three traditional core issues of the World Science Fiction Convention - Hugo Award voting, business meetings and future conference site selection votes - are all closely related to the participation of ordinary science fiction fans.

;

;“Its charm lies in that it is a spirit based on a community of creators. Everyone is both a participant and a creator. This is something given to it by cultural traditions and cannot be replaced or replaced casually. Copied." Chen Shi, co-chairman of this conference, told Southern Weekend reporters that he regretted that for many fantasy fans, this was a conference that they could not reach.

;

;On January 20, 2023, the Chengdu Organizing Committee announced on Twitter that the date of the event would be postponed from August 16, 2023 to October 18. "At least a hundred of my psychedelic friends can't come," said Qianxing, a college student. His school is far away from Chengdu, and he is one of the few people who can take leave. Qianxing came to the venue wearing a silver-blue cosplay costume, which was very conspicuous.

;

;If these fantasy fans can come to the Chengdu Science Fiction Museum, in this huge, hollow building, they will first see a 9-meter-high giant "Benben" statue in the hall (movie The robot in "The Wandering Earth"), at night, the spotlights surrounding it make the colors on its surface begin to flow, creating "clumsy" in various states.

;

;The two large exhibition halls on the first floor are the enterprise exhibition hall and the science fiction fan exhibition hall. Most of the dozens of booths in the corporate exhibition hall are Chinese companies. Some sell science fiction cultural creations, some make projections, and more are engaged in science fiction publishing. The sound and light effects of their booth are eye-catching, which is obviously different from the psychedelic exhibition area next to it. The corporate exhibition hall is a unit that has never been seen in previous World Science Fiction Conventions. The support of the government, the participation of enterprises, and the brand promotion of a large number of sponsors have given the conference more official color and commercial value.

;

;The vicinity of the Science Fiction Hall cannot meet the travel and catering needs of so many exhibitors. An exhibitor told Southern Weekend reporters, "What kind of tickets should be used, how to arrange the buses, and how to distribute the agenda" were all figured out after coming here; there are still very few businesses around this brand-new venue. If you don't want to To eat at the venue's restaurants, such as KFC and Subway, you have to go several kilometers away to find food at noon every day.

;

;Compared with the coolness of the corporate exhibition area, the science fiction fan exhibition area looks much simpler. A table, a flag, an introduction card or a QR code. They come from university clubs, foreign science fiction organizations, and unfamous amateur authors... It's a bit like a recruitment scene for university clubs. On the table of the Tibetan science fiction club, there are Tibetan science fiction works published over the years. A Tibetan young man patiently introduced the history of Tibetan science fiction to curious onlookers. This kind of atmosphere is more like the previous World Science Fiction Convention. Science fiction literature research scholar Yan Feng once participated in the 2019 World Science Fiction Convention in Dublin. He recalled that the atmosphere there was "free and loose." He said.

;

;The conference rooms on the second and third floors of the Science Fiction Museum are used to hold various "salons". The so-called "salons" are various seminars organized by science fiction fans themselves. Science fiction fans invite their own guests and choose their own topics. After submitting the submission to the organizing committee, it is usually approved. Then the organizing committee arranges the time and venue and does not interfere with other matters. The number of salon sessions at previous World Science Fiction Conventions has been stable between three and four hundred. There were more than 400 salons registered for the Chengdu World Science Fiction Convention, and more than 230 salons were eventually reserved.

;

;This time the Chengdu Organizing Committee invited a total of more than 600 guests, including more than 180 overseas guests (more than 150 people were present), who formed the main group of the salon. In the past World Science Fiction Convention, only a small number of officially invited guests were invited by science fiction fans themselves.

;

;Chen Shi also applied for a salon at the World Science Fiction Convention in Chicago. "I just bring a form, and the organizing committee directly tells me the location and time. You can just do it yourself, and they won't care about you." Chen Shi said, "In China's cultural background, this may not be the case. Suitable."

;

;"The foreign World Science Fiction Convention is very attractive to the fantasy fandom, but if you don't leave the fandom, their core members are more than 20,000, and the number of people who come every year does not change much. It has formed its own community culture. There are cultural thresholds to enter this community. If we completely copy that, it may be very miserable. It is difficult for this thing to enter various circles." When Chen Shi first thought about what to do At some kind of world science fiction conference, he had already decided to take a different path.

;

;Yang Feng is the CEO of the science fiction publishing company Baguangfen. The "Oral History of Chinese Science Fiction" she edited was also shortlisted for the 2023 Hugo Award. She has participated in several World Science Fiction Conventions. She recalled the previous salons and exhibitions to Southern Weekend reporters, “It was like a party for science fiction fans, with not many ‘high-end’ designs and full of various cosplayers (two-dimensional image imitators). When walking around the market, there are also people who gather in a small circle and play guitar all day long."

;

;What makes her linger here is the former flea market. Every year, science fiction fans sell their collections, handicrafts, The second-hand books were auctioned at the flea market at the World Science Fiction Convention. Everyone wrote their desired price on a small sign, and the one with the highest price got it. "Almost every time I take pictures at the convention, I get something I like."

;

;;"Business Meeting";;of;;query, debate;;and;;voting;; strong>;

;

;"Hello, your speech is not related to the question of yes or no, but another topic." "Hello, your time to speak is up."

;

;Qianxing’s speech was interrupted from time to time by the timekeeper on the podium. This is Qianxing's first time at the World Science Fiction Convention, and like most Chinese science fiction fans, it is his first time to experience an affairs conference. Many Chinese science fiction fans hang out in exhibition areas and salons, but often ignore this important meeting.

;

;But old science fiction fans all know that "only by attending business meetings can you have a deep understanding of the organization and participation methods of the World Science Fiction Association and the World Science Fiction Convention, and you will feel some interesting things." place." Chen Shi said.

;

;"Business Meeting" is an important agenda of every conference, even the core agenda. During this four-to-five-day meeting, members supervised various affairs of the World Science Fiction Congress through questioning, debate, and voting, and were also responsible for revising certain provisions of the World Science Fiction Association Charter, the cornerstone of the World Science Fiction Congress. . In English, this charter is called a constitution.

;

;The practice of this conference seems new and even a bit exciting to most Chinese science fiction fans. "What is a sunset clause?" When they encounter legal terms they don't understand, they will express them candidly on the spot. Their questions are listened to carefully by people from all over the world.

;

;If you have personally experienced the process and debate of the business meeting, it is not difficult to understand why the fandom calls the meeting a "constitutional amendment meeting." The business meetings of the Chengdu World Science Fiction Convention are held in the Meteor Hall of the Science Fiction Hall, which is a small hall independent of the main hall. People with membership can enter to listen, express opinions and vote at any time.

;

;Qianxing is the most active speaker among the Chinese members present. He has to express his own opinions on almost every topic. When he gets selfless, he often exceeds the speaking time and is asked to stop speaking. This is A meeting in which speeches and debates were conducted strictly in accordance with Robert's Rules of Order.

;

;“There are fewer people coming this year, but it was more lively in previous years.” Xixia, director of Baguangfen Film and Television, told Southern Weekend reporters. There will be a preparatory meeting before the annual business meeting to discuss the specific arrangements for the business meeting. The preparatory meetings in previous years were also very lively. Often within a few minutes of the host's speech, a member would jump out and question various arrangements. "Some people said how many translators should be provided, and some people said how the screen should be displayed. In the end, both sides debated Do you want to start the two-minute preparatory meeting?" Chen Shi recalled.

;

;Due to the small number of people coming, Deputy Adjudicator Kevin Stanley revealed to Chen Shi that 2023 should be the year with the least "wrangling" in the preparatory meeting.

;

;The Meteor Hall is far from full. There are two thick books at the door, the Chinese and English versions of "Robert's Rules of Procedure". If members have any opinions on the debate process, they can check it at any time. Xixia brought his own "Constitutional Amendment" this time. He wants to add a Hugo Award to be awarded to science fiction films produced by independent filmmakers. He believes that the current "Best Dramatic Performance (Feature Film)" The awards pay too much attention to commercial blockbusters and ignore independent films.

;

;Most fantasy fans in the 1950s were fans of science fiction novels, so the first Hugo Award was established for the best novel in 1953. Since then, fan magazines and theater performances have been slowly added. and comics awards. If you look at the award-winning films over the years, you will find that most of them are Hollywood commercial productions. Xixia believes that it is necessary to change this situation.

;

;“For example, in terms of novel awards, we have already awarded awards to the most commercially successful and famous novels, but there are also some fan-created novels that have not received commercial attention but are considered well-written by the industry. For very good novels, the Hugo Awards will award them with Best Fan Author, Best Fan Magazine, and Best Fan Podcast. There should also be such an award in the film category," Xixia said.

;

;It will take at least two years to pass new amendments at the "Constitutional Amendment Conference". If the proposal can be debated and passed at the first year's conference, it will become a formal amendment proposal. It will be debated for a second time in the second year. Only after it is passed can the "constitutional amendment" be considered successful.

;

;There are two proposals for second-instance debate in 2023, one of which is "whether to add a Hugo Award for the best game or interactive work." The Chinese members present seemed to be generally cautious about this proposal. They questioned the definition of "game", especially since the boundaries of science fiction games seemed not to be clear.

;

;"The debate time is over. Those who support this proposal please stand up...those who oppose this proposal please stand up..." Adjudicator Donald Eastlake said. The final voting result was 10:3, and the amendment was passed, which means that this award will be added to the Hugo Awards in the future.

;

;Qianxing’s most exciting speech was about a new proposal for 2023. This new proposal put forward by Kevin Stanley calls for the future World Science Fiction Convention to be held preferably between August 1 and September 30. If it exceeds this range, it should be held with the next one. Negotiations with the host city. Qianxing’s opinion is that in addition to negotiating with the next organizer, we also need to discuss with the members.

;

;"Participants of the membership meeting have the right to know that the date of the meeting is to be changed. They negotiate with the organizing committee. The organizing committee may not adopt the member's opinions, but there must be such negotiation. There must be a stage for expressing opinions." During a break in the business meeting, Southern Weekend reporters interviewed Qianxing. He looked a little excited and strode up to the podium. He spoke slowly but forcefully, hoping to add the terms negotiated with members to Kevin's proposal.

;

;After voting, Kevin’s proposal was passed, but Qianxing’s supplementary clause was not passed. However, the entire meeting was recorded on video, and Qianxing's speeches and opinions have been recorded and become the permanent historical archives of the World Science Fiction Convention.

;

;Xixia’s proposal also passed the preliminary review. At next year's World Science Fiction Convention in Glasgow, Kevin and Xixia's proposal will be reviewed, debated, and voted on by members again. In this way, the "World Science Fiction Association Charter" allows the World Science Fiction Conference to respond to the changes of the times and the demands of fantasy fans.

;

;Setting records and making history

;

;On the evening of October 21, 2023, the 81st Chengdu World Science Fiction Conference awarded this Hugo Award. Prior to this, many faces of color have been added to the nominations for this year's awards, and the Chinese finalists are eye-catching.

;

;Chinese illustrator Zhao Enzhe won the Best Professional Artist Award, "Zero Gravity" edited by Chinese science fiction fans He He and Ling Shizhen won the Best Fan Magazine Award, and science fiction writer Hai Miao's novel "Time and Space" The Painter" won the "Best Short Novella Award". According to the tradition of the Hugo Awards, the organizing committee of the conference will disclose the voting details and data after the awards. For example, the data of the 2022 World Science Fiction Convention in Chicago can still be found on the official website. After the conference, the official website of the Hugo Awards wrote: "Currently we do not have the details of this voting data. We will announce the data as soon as we obtain it." The official Chinese website of the Chengdu World Science Fiction Conference is also temporarily unavailable. this data.

;

;Dave McCarty, head of the Hugo Award Selection Committee, told reporters after the awards night: "Hai Miao's "The Painter of Space and Time" does not have an English translation. It has created a complete novel without an English translation. The history of winning awards for Chinese works." This means that most of the members who voted for "Painter of Time and Space" may be Chinese readers.

;

;On the second day after the awards, the "Galaxy's Edge" (mook) which published "The Painter of Space and Time" was sold out in the science fiction museum. Because there were so many people asking, the bookshelf in the science fiction fan area had to wait Put up a "Sold Out" sign.

;

;Of course Liu Cixin’s works are also selling hotly. Liu Cixin’s autograph session will be held at 2 pm on October 20. Other writers’ autograph sessions are usually only arranged for 20 minutes. The organizer gave Liu Cixin a preview. Three hours were left for signings. Fans packed the signing hall on the third floor early. The queue stretched from the third floor to the first floor, and then snaked half a circle around the venue. Many fans whose legs were sore from standing sat on Liu's book.

;

;It is not easy for the publishing organizations participating in the exhibition to sign and sell their books at this venue.

;

;Xi Xi is an editor of a publishing organization. This time he brought an author's science fiction novel to Chengdu and organized a salon, hoping that science fiction fans can have a good chat with the author himself. Host a book signing. At first, Xixi reported the entire process to the organizing committee, but a few days before the opening, she received a notice that the salon could not be placed together with the autograph signing. "In normal book fairs, there are book signings after the exchange between authors and readers, but here the two venues must be separated and the time periods must be separated," Xixi said. This means that readers who are interested in the author have to make two trips to get a signed copy.

;

;There are various salons, forums, and summits at the World Science Fiction Convention, but in addition to the opening and closing ceremonies and the Hugo Award presentation party, there is also an "Industrial Development Summit" where almost all major guests are invited The summit was attended with a lineup worthy of Hugo Awards night.

;

;This is the first time an industry development-related conference has been held at the World Science Fiction Convention. At the meeting, a number of plans related to the development of the science fiction industry were announced, including the "Chengdu Consensus on the Science Fiction Industry", the "Tianwen" Plan, the "2023 China Chengdu Science Fiction Industry Report", etc., and there was even a centralized signing ceremony for science fiction industry projects. According to According to statistics, there are 21 signed projects with a total investment of 8 billion yuan.

;

;At this "Industrial Development Summit", Liu Cixin no longer talked about literature, but talked about industrial development: "Chengdu has long planned the layout of the science fiction industry, related industrial planning and industrial policies , talent policies, etc. have all been implemented."

;

;"Science fiction industry chain ecosystem", "IP creation" and "strengthening the image of a science fiction city". Faced with these various fresh vocabulary, Canadian science fiction writer Robert Sawyer said, “I am very shocked to see you turning science fiction into an industry.” He said that those who do these things in North America may be publishers, and science fiction is a career that is random, aimless, and without long-term planning. These industry figures were generally not invited to previous World Science Fiction Conventions, and most of those who came were writers and editors.

;

;This area where the Chengdu Science Fiction Museum is located will also be built into the science fiction highland of Chengdu. According to a person close to the local government, a reporter from Southern Weekend said that a science fiction industrial park may be built here in the future. “That street is a science fiction themed block, and science fiction companies may move in in the future. This area is said to be A science fiction camping base, there will be training camps for science fiction writers and summer camps for students every year, and the science fiction museum itself is a large-scale consumption + public welfare space. This circle will be built into a science fiction themed tourist destination." He stood On the high platform, his fingers drew a large arc from one end to the other.

;

;“The local government has done support work such as venues and transportation, and also mobilized many volunteers,” Chen Shi said. “The core of the appeal is two points. One is to enhance Chengdu’s city brand image, and the other is to support Science fiction industry." This conference also set a record - it attracted the most sponsors ever.

;

;;";;What makes Chinese young people like science fiction?";

;

;The fantasy exhibition area in the afternoon was extremely noisy, even though this One day is already the last day of the World Science Fiction Convention. A robot drummer was beating the drums in a loop in the corner. Parents took their children on public transportation for two hours, and now they have just entered the museum. The children were holding notebooks with stamps and clocks in their hands, and they were screaming and shuttling through various booths. between. There is also a science fiction fan who is promoting his own book: "The book I wrote is completely opposite to Liu Cixin's world view..."

;

;In this sea of ​​noise, there is a person taking a nap on a chair . He had white hair, a cowboy hat on the table, and his eyes were lowered, as if he had entered another world. His name is James Joseph, from Australia. He is in his seventies and has been a science fiction fan for nearly fifty years. In 1975, the World Science Fiction Convention was held in Oceania for the first time. He was moved by the atmosphere of science fiction and has been to the World Science Fiction Convention 15 times so far.

;

;James told Southern Weekend reporters that this conference is the most special one he has ever been to. He has never seen so many enthusiastic and young science fiction fans in Europe or the United States before.

;

;Youth is a key word of this conference. "I signed more names today than in the past 56 years combined." Nicholas White seemed a little flattered when he was surrounded by primary school students looking for his signature. The students walked along the booth and checked in one by one, asking for autographs. The organizing committee has reached cooperation with many primary and secondary schools in Chengdu and organized many students to attend various salons and forums. There was almost no silence in the science fiction museum.

;

;Alan Brandt, a member of the 2025 Seattle Fantasy Organizing Committee, told Southern Weekend reporters that the scale of the Chengdu World Science Fiction Convention is the largest he has ever seen. The previous record holder was held in London in 2014, with around 10,000 participants. According to figures released by official media, the number of participants in Chengdu exceeded 20,000.

;

;In the West, the golden age of science fiction literature was the decades after World War II. At that time, the United States and the Soviet Union were competing for hegemony, and the Western economy was developing rapidly. Science fiction literature followed the trend and became the spiritual home of many young people at that time. More than half a century has passed, and the science fiction fans of those days are getting older. Old Western science fiction fans like James Joseph, whose silver hair is the highlight of the Chengdu Science Fiction Museum. "For American science fiction works, many readers are gray-haired, that is, only middle-aged and elderly people read science fiction works. But in China, on the contrary, young people prefer science fiction works. This is my confusion, what makes Chinese young people like it? Science fiction?" Robert Sawyer asked this question in Chengdu.

;

;Every previous conference would set up a memorial area. This is a place for middle-aged and elderly science fiction fans to reminisce and reminisce about the past. In 2017, the British science fiction writer Brian Aldiss passed away. There was a small space at the World Science Fiction Convention that year, which displayed his works and photos during his lifetime, as well as some of his treasures, a simple A black and white TV plays interviews with him during his lifetime. In 2023, Aldis's daughter Wendy also came to Chengdu. She told Southern Weekend reporters that the Chengdu World Science Fiction Convention was originally going to hold an exhibition for these photos, but it was not possible "because of lack of space."

;

;Yang Feng originally planned to hold a commemorative exhibition at the conference. The person being remembered is Michael Resnick, the former editor-in-chief of the American science fiction magazine "Galaxy's Edge". After Resnick's death in 2020, his collection and books were put up for online auction, and Baguangfen bought a large number of his collections. "Look, this glass showcase is full of his things." Yang Feng pointed to a glass Cabinet said. At the beginning, the organizer promised an exhibition area of ​​70 square meters. Worried about missing the exhibition, the collection "spent tens of thousands of yuan on freight to be shipped back." Later, the exhibition area was occupied by many technology companies, and Yang Feng was only given a glass showcase.

;

;"Their golden age has indeed passed." Yan Feng said, "And China's science fiction craze has many characteristics of the Internet. I see a lot of people chasing stars here and hear a lot of screaming. Especially for people like Liu and Guo Fan. The development of Chinese science fiction has its luck, and the boost from Internet culture is very powerful."

;

;He Xi, a local science fiction writer in Chengdu, believes that the current Chinese science fiction Science fiction is in the early stages of its third wave. "The first time was the prosperity of all industries at the beginning of the founding of the People's Republic of China, the second time was the 'Spring of Science' in 1979, and now is the third time." He said. Wang Jinkang, another science fiction writer who has stopped writing, also recalled the low ebb of Chinese science fiction in the 1990s. “At that time, Chinese science fiction was wild and wild and received little attention from society. However, there were also many science fiction fans. When we went to universities to participate in activities, they all I used chalk to write "Welcome Mr. Wang Jinkang" on the blackboard, and started communicating like this. The simplicity back then had its charm, and I still miss it very much. It is indeed different now."

;

;"Can you There was a faint sense of a conflict between science fiction cultures in the conference venue," Zero Gravity News editor Ling Shizhen told a Southern Weekend reporter about his observations, "but I don't think this conflict is harmful. Or things that are meaningless, this is a necessary process. Since you want to embrace a truly diverse world, this step cannot be escaped."

;

;As a university teacher, Yan Feng has not been in the classroom for a long time. He has met so many international friends at domestic academic conferences, which moved him quite a bit. “The divided world is becoming more and more isolated from each other, even confrontational and hostile, but science fiction must transcend national boundaries to think about the human level. Problem, this is also the valuable part of science fiction." As Liu Cixin has emphasized on different occasions, "In science fiction, human beings appear as a whole."

;

;Alan Brandt said Seattle The World Science Fiction Convention has secured the venue, but the local science fiction association is still negotiating with the hotel in order to get a lower price. Nicholas White said that he was a little "jealous" of Chengdu. He estimated that next year's World Science Fiction Convention in Glasgow would not be able to attract so much sponsorship: "Obviously, the Chengdu World Science Fiction Convention has received huge support from the local government, which is difficult to achieve in Europe. ."

;

;(Xi Xi and Qian Xing are pseudonyms, and Southern Weekend intern Chen Quanxin also contributed to this article)

;

;A few days ago, the Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region Medical Insurance Bureau and other departments issued the "About the Inclusion of Some Therapeutic Assisted Reproductive Medical Services" "Notice on the Payment Scope of Basic Medical Insurance and Work-related Injury Insurance Funds", which includes assisted reproductive projects such as egg retrieval, embryo culture, and embryo transplantation into the payment scope of basic medical insurance. The reimbursement ratios of employee medical insurance and resident medical insurance are 70% and 50% respectively. The new regulations will take effect on November 1, 2023. According to Li Rong, director of the Reproductive Medical Center of Nanning Second People's Hospital, according to the above notice, women with fertility difficulties can be reimbursed for first- or second-generation in vitro fertilization, ranging from more than 4,000 yuan to more than 10,000 yuan, depending on the type of insurance.

;

;This move once again aroused attention and discussion. Previously, several provinces have included assisted reproduction projects in basic medical insurance. Since July 1 this year, Beijing has included 16 therapeutic assisted reproductive technology projects, including in vitro fertilization and artificial insemination, into the scope of basic medical insurance reimbursement; Liaoning has also included 18 assisted reproductive technology projects such as embryo culture and embryo transfer this year. Reproductive projects are included in the catalog of maternity insurance. It is conceivable that more provinces will follow suit, and assisted reproductive technology will be included in basic medical insurance or become standard equipment.

;

;There are mainly two types of families that benefit from this medical insurance policy: one type of family is for elderly mothers who have reproductive needs but have difficulty conceiving naturally, and the other type of family is for infertility (not caused by age factors) , such as congenital factors, reproductive history, lifestyle or environmental factors.

;

;Zhang Xuehong, an expert from the National Human Assisted Reproductive Technology Review Group, said: It is generally believed that the physiologically ideal reproductive age for women is 22-28 years old, or at least no more than 35 years old, because fertility or ovarian function cannot be achieved before the age of 35. It reaches a peak and then declines rapidly, and the risk of over-age childbirth will also increase; and, according to her clinical experience, the average age of patients seeking assisted reproduction has tended to become younger in recent years.

;

;The demand for assisted reproduction in the first category of families stems from the fact that as marriage and childbirth continue to be postponed, the number of infertile people due to age is increasing. According to the 2017 Fertility Situation Sample Survey data, from 2006 to 2016, the average age of first childbirth for Chinese women increased from 24.3 years old in 2006 to 26.9 years old in 2016. In big cities, the age of first childbirth and childbearing is even later. For example, in Shanghai in 2022, the average age of first childbirth will be 30.36 years old, and the average age of childbirth will be 31.18 years old.

;

;For the second type of infertile families, in addition to congenital factors, reproductive history is also a major factor that cannot be bypassed. In 2021, Qiao Jie, Dean of Peking University Third Hospital, released the "Lancet Special Invited Major Report on Maternal and Child Health in China". The report stated that between 2007 and 2020, the incidence of infertility in my country increased from 12% to 18%. In terms of reproductive history, miscarriage, especially repeated miscarriage, may lead to postoperative salpingitis, endometritis, or even fallopian tube adhesions and uterine cavity adhesions, which may lead to infertility. The above-mentioned report shows that from 2005 to 2017, China’s induced abortion rate increased from 20.2‰ to 27.3‰. Among women in China who have experienced at least one miscarriage, the repeat miscarriage rate is 65.2%. The high miscarriage rate and repeated miscarriage rate are highly positively correlated with the infertility rate.

;

;Turning to assisted reproductive technology, such as in vitro fertilization, because of a strong desire to have a child is not an easy matter. Basically, it is a matter of luck to succeed once and for all. From eggs to embryo culture and then to embryo transplantation, problems may occur in every step and the success may fail. The pain suffered by the body and the pressure endured by the spirit cannot be explained to outsiders. The cost is not only money, time and energy, but also mental burden and wear and tear.

;

;In this sense, the inclusion of IVF in basic medical insurance can only partially cover the financial costs borne by these families, but it cannot fundamentally solve the problem of infertility, because infertility is both a medical problem and , is also a social issue. Generally speaking, if a problem is taken seriously before it appears or is in its infancy, the cost is the lowest if it needs to be prevented and solved if it needs to be solved. Waiting until it becomes a large-scale social problem before dealing with it will not only increase the cost exponentially. rise, and the effect is unsatisfactory.

;

;Theoretically, the infertility problem that can be solved is: pushing the age of first childbearing forward to fall within the optimal childbearing age range, which requires early marriage and childbirth; reducing the miscarriage rate, especially repeated miscarriage rate, which means reducing or even avoiding unplanned pregnancies. This is better than resorting to assisted reproductive technology in the future. For individuals and families, it is obvious that they can consider and make decisions in this way. However, once a problem becomes a social problem, it is not that simple, because the essence of this social problem is a problem of values.

;

;Many people attribute the delay in the age of marriage and childbearing, the decline in fertility rate, and the rise of unmarried and childless people to the high cost of childbearing. But when it comes to fertility, the benefit side is obviously more important than the cost side. Nowadays, many young men and women ask "What is the meaning of getting married, forming a family and having children?" This in itself means a sudden change in the fertility instinct and the values ​​of marriage and childbirth.

;

;Today we live in an era of unprecedented peace and prosperity. Material abundance is unprecedented. This will first lead to the reduction and disappearance of selection pressure. At this time, the population is more inclined to enjoy self-enjoyment rather than sacrificing self-enjoyment. , go through all kinds of hardships to raise offspring; secondly, it will lead to the rise of the concept of non-marriage and childbearing, which in turn will further suppress the desire to marry and have children.

;

;As for the high abortion rate, especially the repeated abortion rate, from a technical perspective, it is nothing more than a question of strengthening contraceptive measures; from a moral perspective, there is also a question of how to strengthen sexual morality. Parents should care about their children's values ​​and teach them by words and deeds to have a serious and prudent attitude towards sex: men should of course respect women's rights and wishes and assume due responsibilities; women, as the first person responsible for their own physical and mental health, should protect Regarding one's own body and reproductive health, in Chinese judicial practice, reproductive rights or reproductive decision-making rights are unique to women. The other side of this right means the ultimate responsibility to oneself.

; Wed, 01 Nov 2023 14:55:03 +0800 在3260米的香格里拉高山植物园，普通比浪漫重要http://www.infzm.com/contents/259715
;;2023-11-01 14:00:00;
;

;;

;

;Shangri-La Alpine Botanical Garden at an altitude of 3,260 meters. Visual China|Picture

;

;What is it like working in a botanical garden? This has intrigued me for a long time.

;

;During the countless late nights when I was incompetent in writing, I wanted to resign and go to the botanical garden to be a gardener. The dream soon came true, and the location was actually Shangri-La. In September 2023, I became an intern gardener at Shangri-La Alpine Botanical Garden.

;

;Shangri-La, formerly known as Zhongdian, is located in Diqing Tibetan Autonomous Prefecture, Yunnan. At 3,260 meters, it is the highest botanical garden in the world. It protects about a thousand species of higher plants on land equivalent to 1/5 of the Summer Palace. There are many endemic species named after Zhongdian, such as Zhongdian rose, Zhongdian hawthorn, etc. Some of them are nationally protected wild plants.

;

;The strange thing is that hundreds of plateau plants are bred here, and they are basically not exotic flowers and plants, or even "ordinary and common"; most botanical gardens belong to The Shangri-La Alpine Botanical Garden is a public institution with financial allocations, but it is a private non-enterprise organization with "three noes" - "no money", "no one" and "no establishment". It was planned to be established in 1999 and opened in 2005. It relies on itself to find a way to survive. road.

;

;All this gives Shangri-La Alpine Botanical Garden an independent and romantic color. However, after the short internship and interview, the romance had long since dissipated for me.

;

;This is a story about finding the meaning of ordinary seeds.

;

;Romantic

;

;Along the Yunnan-Tibet Highway, starting from Shangri-La County and heading northwest, the buildings gradually recede, and large tracts of golden highland barley suddenly burst in. Come into view. In early September, the Napa Sea formed by the melting of summer snow is gradually turning into the green Yila grassland, with horses roaming and white Tibetan-style houses glowing under the clouds.

;

;;

;

;View of Napa Sea from Shangri-La Alpine Botanical Garden. Photo by Liang Jingyi

;

;In a corner of this paradise-like scenery is the place where I want to intern: Shangri-La Alpine Botanical Garden.

;

;At 9 o'clock on September 1st, I started from the east gate of the Botanical Garden, walked through the wild mountains, passed by fungi, climbed over the wooden fence, and almost fell, and I reached the mountainside. nursery. My task today is to move the indoor hypericum seedlings outdoors, and then transport the hypericum to the maze area of ​​the botanical garden on the top of the mountain with a tractor.

;

;;

;

;Tractor loading hypericum in the nursery. Photo by Liang Jingyi

;

;Sounds so simple. The first step is to change equipment. I put on a red and black plaid bear apron that reached my ankles, put on plastic gloves, and held a big pink basin. The second step is to enter the nursery. A nursery is 24 meters long and 8 meters wide, which is equivalent to a classroom. There were hundreds of black bags on the ground, containing hypericum.

;

;;

;

;On June 24, 2023, Huaian, Jiangsu Province, hypericum flowers were in full bloom in Jiulong Lake Park. Visual China | Picture

;

;Hypericum is a common flower in parks and greening projects. When it blooms in June and July, the slender bunch of stamens on the top are as bright as gold threads. The bottom petals look like butterfly wings, so they are also called golden thread butterflies. The hypericum I see now has been sown for two years and has not yet bloomed. It has slender branches and oval leaves. It is fragrant when you get close.

;

;I found that this botanical garden is different from the ones I have been to before. There are neither weird potted plants nor collections of treasures from around the world. On the contrary, there are many native plants similar to Hypericum in the botanical garden, including pink-flowered Zhongdian thorn rose, blue-purple Zhongdian aconitum, red-fruited Zhongdian hawthorn, standing Yunnan pine and alpine pine...their names Just carry local labels, such as "Zhongdian", "Yunnan" and "Gaoshan".

;

;;

;

;Zhongdian Delphinium. Photo provided by the interviewee

;

;Fang Zhendong, the founder and former director of the Botanic Garden, also has a picture of a native plant - Trichosanthes versicolor hanging in his office. He is 59 years old, of medium build, with drooping eyebrows, gray hair, and cheekbones that are black and red rendered by ultraviolet light from the plateau.

;

;Fang Zhendong is from Weixi, Diqing. The local area lacks biological talents. His college entrance examination application was changed from the mathematics department to the biology department. After graduating from Yunnan University, he returned to Works at Diqing Institute of Plateau Biology. Later, he traveled throughout the mountains and valleys of Diqing and wrote the book "Wild Flowers in the Hengduan Mountains of Yunnan, China". When he was almost 35 years old, Fang Zhendong wanted to build a world-class botanical garden in Shangri-La. This was also a romantic thing for him at the time.

;

;;

;

;Fang Zhendong was on an inspection trip to Niru High Mountain Area. Photo provided by the interviewee

;

;Yunnan is the base camp of horticultural plants and has been known to foreign "plant hunters" more than a hundred years ago. There are at most 12,000 plant species in Europe, while Yunnan has 17,000 species, and Shangri-La alone has more than 5,000 species. Alpine valleys with large vertical elevation gradients became a refuge for plants during the Ice Age and a breeding ground for biodiversity.

;

;A Scotsman named George Forrester was sent to China by the Edinburgh Botanic Garden. Starting in 1904, he conducted seven botanical expeditions in the Hengduan Mountains. . He hired eight Naxi people in Baisha, Lijiang, to move a rhododendron with a diameter of more than one meter from Gaoligong Mountain out of the mountains and transport it to the British Museum for display; he used mules to transport 31,000 Yunnan plant seeds and wax leaf specimens, which were recommended To gardens around the world, specimens are used by taxonomists at the Royal Botanic Gardens in Edinburgh to rename and publish new species.

;

;The azaleas and primroses brought back by Forrest from Yunnan are still being bred in the Edinburgh Botanic Garden, and the specimens are kept in the herbarium. In the 1990s, Fang Zhendong went to Edinburgh Botanic Garden. Looking back now, he is still very touched, "Our local plant resources are valued by foreigners, but what about us?"

;

;While talking about this, Fang Zhendong suddenly stood up , found his copy of "Wild Flowers in the Hengduan Mountains of Yunnan, China", pointed to a passage written by his mentor, the late botanist Mr. Qin Renchang, and read word for word:

;

;;;Yunnan The rich source of plants has contributed to the progress of European and American civilization far and wide. It is a pity that our country is backward in science. The Chinese people did not know how to use the treasures of talent to enrich their lives. Instead, they cultivated them in public and private courtyards in large cities and towns. The flowers that are being viewed are almost all imported and have been common in European and American gardens for hundreds of years. Once they enter the country, those who like them flock to them like birds of prey, sacrificing themselves for others, which is a shame. ;;

;

;This passage was written in the 1930s, but even in the 1990s, native species were not valued and were even threatened by alien species. The situation remains. Fang Zhendong still remembers that at that time, a kind of Eupatorium adenophora native to South America entered from southern Yunnan and approached Diqing along the Yunnan-Vietnam Railway. He worries about the impact of invasive alien species on the local ecosystem.

;

;Land use is also changing, with natural pastures being converted into cultivated land, and hillsides being exposed due to sand and stone quarrying. Fang Zhendong discovered that Diqing was originally the area with the richest wild orchid resources in China. In the 1980s, it was not difficult to find orchids every time he entered a ravine. But in the 1990s, the orchid craze took off, and outside owners bought the orchids by the truckload. Since then, wild orchids have been hard to find anywhere.

;

;So Fang Zhendong wants to build a botanical garden. "The first is to conserve local species; the second is to develop and utilize local plant resources for garden construction and cultivation."

;

;In 1999, the Alpine Botanical Garden was approved as a project after discussion by the Yunnan Provincial Development and Reform Commission and the former Environmental Protection Department. A preparatory office was first set up, and Fang Zhendong was appointed as the director. In 2001, construction of the park started, and plants were planted on the exposed scars of sand and stone excavation.

;

;;

;

;Today, green trees grow from the sand pit in the Alpine Botanic Garden.   Liang Jingyi/Photo

;

;Reality

;

;After I changed my clothes in the nursery, I said two words Don't talk, let's do it. I squatted down, used a shovel to dig Hypericum out of the bag, cut off the roots on the ground, and put it into the pot. One bag of Hypericum with seedlings and soil is about 4 pounds, and one pot can hold two bags. After installing it and getting up, I used the strength of my lower back to pick up the pot, walked 10 meters to the outside of the nursery, took out the seedlings, arranged them, and returned. Repeat this.

;

;;

;

;Transporting Hypericum seedlings.   Liang Jingyi/Photo

;

;2, 4, 6... Every time I transport a pot, I count it silently. The number rises and I feel a sense of accomplishment. But starting from the 10th basin, it was a bit difficult to stand up, and my back began to strain. By the 16th pot, it was no longer a problem. I was gasping for air and my heart was pounding. Do you think I'm weak? But I was doing weight-bearing exercises on a plateau three thousand meters above sea level, moving soil in a place where my speaking speed slowed down significantly and I avoided running and jumping.

;

;20, 22, I can’t hold on anymore. At 10:36, it started to rain and the greenhouse leaked. More than an hour of moving work was stopped. I don’t know how grateful I am for this rain. When I stood up, my vision went dark. The light and the romantic imagination of the botanical garden disappeared in this moment.

;

;"When building a botanical garden, will there be a moment when romance disappears?" I asked Fang Zhendong.

;

;"Yes, when it's time to find money."

;

;In 1999, the office to be built in the Botanical Garden was only It is a temporary agency and cannot pay insurance for newly hired employees. In 2004, the Botanical Garden Office invited relevant departments to a meeting to discuss the management system and came up with two options: one is to jointly build a public institution. The Xishuangbanna Tropical Botanical Garden of the Chinese Academy of Sciences and the local government will each establish several establishments to jointly manage it, and it will be operated by central or local financial funds. , which is also a common system in domestic botanical gardens. The other type is private non-enterprise, which is responsible for its own profits and losses, has no financial budget and no establishment.

;

;"We recommended the first set of co-construction plans to the government, but at that time the government's finances were still relatively difficult and the staffing may be tight, so we proposed the second plan. Take care of it first." Fang Zhendong said.

;

;This plan paved the way for subsequent operating pressure.

;

;After the Botanical Garden was established as a private non-enterprise, the first board of directors was also established, and Fang Zhendong became the legal representative, chairman and executive director. The pressure came like a mountain, including finding construction funds, paying employees, and also needing to bear ecological compensation for the local community. In total, the annual cost of maintaining the botanical garden is no less than three million.

;

;Although it is a tourist attraction, it is difficult to make money from tourists. At 17:28 on September 1st, there were still 2 minutes before the park closed. A total of six people bought tickets to enter the botanical garden throughout the day, two foreign tourists and four local tourists, and the total fee was 80 yuan.

;

;Some employees once felt that tourists now like to check in and take photos, and suggested that "we should keep up with the times and create a cherry blossom avenue."

;

;Fang Zhendong denied it very directly, "If you want to see cherry blossoms, go to the park to see them. We are not a park." He felt that the more important thing "is to show the cherry blossoms." Domesticated local native species, (this is) our original intention.”

;

;Botanic gardens are often in debt. A friend of Fang Zhendong always lends him money. "He is a scientist, not a businessman. He can only write scientific research reports and take on greening projects. Some (projects) still cannot collect money." Most people's stress lasts for a month or two at most, but Fang Zhendong persisted for twenty years, relying on scientific research and engineering projects to support it. The situation only eased two or three years ago.

;

;In the 24 years since its establishment, the botanical garden, with the efforts of 20 employees, has built many plants including the Fragrant Snow Medicine Garden, Linzhi Spruce Seed Garden, and Alpine Pine Seed Garden. A specialized garden. Although the business situation has improved, some ideas still remain on paper.

;

;The sign near the south gate of the Botanical Garden says "dry heat type" and "humid type" exhibition greenhouse. Follow the direction and you will see two exposed greenhouses. Crushed limestone. Fang Zhendong made a calculation and found that there are two major parts in greenhouse construction, first is infrastructure construction, and then is species collection and cultivation. The initial investment is estimated to be more than 10 million, and subsequent maintenance will be even more expensive. "Warmth preservation, temperature control, and humidity control must all be considered."

;

;;

;

;The greenhouse is still stuck on street signs and planning.   Photo by Liang Jingyi

;

;"Tired." Fang Ye, the current director of the Botanical Garden, had tired eyes. Three years ago, he took over the botanical garden from his father Fang Zhendong. He wanted to build a smart scenic spot and improve the explanation system, but he was stuck because there was no one.

;

;Local young people are more willing to work within the system, while outsiders find it too remote. Fang Ye finally found a person born in Guangxi in 1995 on Weibo. A college student who stayed for 4 years and left "without saying anything". Four years is already a long time, and Fang Ye is recruiting people now and he doesn't expect to stay that long.

;

;Fang Ye still hopes that the botanical garden can be merged into a public institution. Before the merger, this private non-corporate organization has to find its own way out.

;

;When the rain stopped, I counted more than a hundred bags of hypericum on the wall. A master gardener took off his apron, I saw him wrapped around a white jockstrap.

;

;Seeds

;

;The first step in raising hypericum seedlings in the Alpine Botanical Garden Nursery is naturally to have seeds.

;

;The gardener took me to see the seeds of Hypericum. As soon as I walked into the seed warehouse on the second floor of the nursery, the scent of rosin hit my face. This is the first time I have seen so many "dry goods": the cones of alpine pine are like elastic brown balls, the seeds of lupine are like thumb-sized lotus pods, and the fruits of Nyingchi spruce are like hard and sun-dried roses.

;

;He grabbed a handful from a large sack and said, "These are the seeds of Hypericum." I looked closer and saw that they were lighter than sand and smaller than sawdust. They ran away when the wind blew and multiplied with the wind. This is the natural law of survival.

;

;But it is difficult for humans to collect seeds. When hypericum planting season comes in November, the botanical garden will invite villagers to collect hypericum seeds in the wild.

;

;But not all seeds can be obtained from villagers. Employees of the botanical garden also have to go to the wild to collect seeds, while also inspecting very small populations and collecting specimens. Extremely small populations refer to wild plants that have a narrow distribution area, are severely disturbed by the outside world, and are on the verge of extinction at any time. It's extremely difficult to find them.

;

;;

;

;The Botanical Garden collects the seeds of S. truncatula. Photo provided by the interviewee

;

;The diary of an employee named Haixian recorded an "ordinary day" during the inspection:

;

;;August 17, 2020, an ordinary day. Many major events happened in the world, but they have nothing to do with us for the time being. We walked in the back mountains of Naixia Village, Gyirong Town, Gyirong County, Shigatse Prefecture, the Pure Land of Tibet. We focused on field investigation work and were far away from the hustle and bustle of information. It seemed that all rumors had lost their carriers and became nameless islands. In such an environment, we seem to have a lot to say every day, and we seem to say the same thing every day. ;

;

;;"Are you hungry?"... To be honest, I am also a little hungry, but This is nothing...;

;

;;It's just that the body is like a sponge absorbing the fog and water on the mountain top. It's full of water, so wet that it feels like it's been stuffed in a refrigerator when it's taken off. A cold chill shoots out from your spine. Then the stove was stuffed into the lungs, and the cold air was sucked in, which made the lungs hurt. foot? I don’t have much hope for it anymore, I just hope there won’t be a strike before returning to my residence...;

;

;;Today I went too long and went too far. ;

;

;;Rising from an altitude of 2,800 meters to an altitude of 4,000 meters, just to look for Huopanglian. ;

;

;If you can collect seeds, all this hard work will be reduced to a short line in the worksheet. For example:

;

;;Haixian, Fang Ye and other high mountain monitoring teams, In the back mountain of Jilong Town, Coptis chinensis seeds. ;

;

;Unlike ordinary seeds that are packed in sacks, those seeds that have been collected with great difficulty are locked in a small room and stored with dignity. In each glass jar or plastic box, here is a seed bank - "Noah's Ark of plateau plants".

;

;;

;

;Seeds in the seed bank.   Liang Jingyi/Photo

;

;The green velvet seeds in the small box are like crushed sesame seeds, at the 4786-meter Mangdongda Mountain in Qamdo, Tibet on August 7, 2022 Picked from the pass. Green velvet, also known as "alpine peony" and "dream flower", grows on flowstone beaches or on the edge of glaciers at an altitude of more than three or four thousand meters. The whole plant is covered with downy hairs or bristles, and its color is clear and eye-catching. Three species of green velvet have been designated as national secondary key protected wild plants.

;

;;

;

;Green velvet. Photo provided by the interviewee

;

;After harvesting, the seeds need to go through a process of soaking and seed selection. Empty or underfilled seeds will float up and be fished out and thrown away. . But Liu Lin was reluctant to soak the seeds of green velvet because it was too difficult to collect. "It would be a pity to throw them away if the seedlings can emerge even if they float." The deputy director of the botanical garden is tall and has two blushes on her face. The table is full of plant tables. She manages the collection, breeding, domestication and utilization of seeds.

;

;There are very few examples of successful breeding of green velvet. On December 5, 2022, Liu Lin and her colleagues planted a batch of green velvet. One month later, the emergence rate was less than 50%. Green velvet "is most likely to die when it grows two leaves. It will die if there is too much water, and it will die if there is too little water, so it is very difficult." I asked her how many seedlings survived in the end. She pointed to the pile of soil in the distance and said, "Look, half of them are already dead."

;

;After working for more than ten years, Liu Lin has long been accustomed to accepting the death of plants. After many battles and difficult passes, there is still the process of tempering the seedlings after they emerge - taking measures such as ventilation, cooling, and proper water control to train the seedlings. She still remembers the Nepalese yellow flowers she planted for the first time. They were raised in a nursery greenhouse for half a year and moved out to refine the seedlings. All of them died in one winter, and only two or three of the 20,000 trees were left.

;

;We can only start over. They figured that maybe it was too cold and the transplanting season was wrong. So while the Nepalese yellow flower seedlings are still in the greenhouse, occasionally put them out to practice in the sun for a while, and then transplant them when they are firmer. There is no previous experience in the breeding of these plateau native plants, so "we can only try to do it."

;

;Like the hypericum I moved today, the seedlings sprout easily, but for some reason, the seedlings tend to die when transplanted. So they came up with a new plan: fill the bag with soil, put the seeds in the soil, and when the seedlings grow up, just tear the bag open and plant it into the ground.

;

;我能看到的每棵纤纤金丝桃都是奇迹，历经生死。然而金丝桃并不属于珍稀物种，也没有进保护名录，刘琳、园丁师傅们费尽心力繁育的本土植物，最终要去哪呢？

;

;修复

;

;2023年8月30日，我跟着绿色和平团队在离香格里拉不远的一条公路看到，一些为修路炸开的山，裸露的地块上种了整整齐齐的杉树，可叶子发蔫发黄，在高寒的山里耷拉着。绿色和平的研究员不无惋惜地说，“这些树估计都是活不成的。”

;

;刘琳说，很多生态修复都是买外来树种，价格便宜，容易扦插，但很难适应当地环境，后期的维护管理也比较难，严重影响成活率。方晔解释，很多人觉得生态修复，就是一两年内检查验收时绿起来就够了。

;

;香格里拉在1980、1990年代遭遇过大规模商业采伐，2010年后，大家意识到了生态修复的重要性。但是方震东感觉，最初的生态修复“根本没有好的理念和思路，绿化公司按现成方案找现成树种，也不管植物能不能适应（环境）”。

;

;8月28日，我在香格里拉参加了一场关于生态修复的研讨会，来自云南大学、中国林业科学研究院的专家们也认为真正的生态修复不是单纯种树和绿化：在黄土高原不顾一切地种树，不让间伐，森林过密会给水源少的地方雪上加霜； 火未必是“万恶之源”，对于有的森林，火只是把表层烧焦，种子在火烧后给予时间，则会焕发生机。

;

;研讨会后，方震东带我们去看大果青杄——松科云杉属乔木，国家二级保护植物。他说，政策规定谁砍伐谁恢复，大果青杄被大量用来造林。建植物园时，有课题组也申请退化林地的植被恢复课题，在植物园种了300亩的大果青杄。刚种上时生长很慢，到一米后快速生长，果实红而光滑，观赏性很好。

;

;方震东忽然停下讲解，寻找记者，提醒我记下来。他接着说，香格里拉一处景点有一片大果青杄林地，相继出现病害、虫害。有一种云杉鳃扁叶蜂会把这个树的针叶全部啃光。另外有一种真菌病害，树叶莫名其妙开始黄，紧接着整个树干就干枯，树成片死亡。香格里拉高山植物园也发生过虫害，但后来没有了，也许被其他的生物控制住了。

;

;但在很多地方，整片云杉被病害侵蚀，传入当地的落叶松。然而，本地云杉不会长这种病害。 “我们跟林业部门建议，今后造林了不要用这个（大果青杄）种，要用我们本地的云杉。”

;

;;

;

;植物园里的大果青扦梁静怡/摄

;

;2006年，方震东领会到生态修复演替理论：植物群落是动态变化的，随着时间的推移，一个植物群落被另一个植物群落代替。

;

;从裸露地表开始，草种飞进来演变成草本植被；鸟兽把灌木和乔木种子通过粪便排在这里，演变成灌丛；乔木十几年后长成优势植被，变成森林；不同种类的乔木经过幼龄、中龄慢慢成熟，上百年后成为顶级植被。

;

;采伐开矿则是重新将顶级植被打回原始的裸露地表，如果没有人为干预，自然依然会重来一轮演替。而方震东团队尝试把上百年的演替时间缩短，比如依靠风鸟兽传播种子要数十年，人工播种插苗则只需几天。

;

;演替的过程中，有的植物被称为“先锋植物”，它们很快萌芽，覆盖住地表。

;

;“比如我搬运的金丝桃？”我问方震东。

;

;“对，它算是一种先锋植物，在2000-3300米的海拔范围，在火烧地上能自然生长起来。”

;

;香格里拉植物园里的本土植物适应了高寒、恶劣的环境，在生态修复中，后续维护费低，也不容易受到病虫害影响。

;

;近年来，生态修复失败的项目纷纷到植物园请教经验。困于经营的植物园也找到生存之道，不再负债。

;

;;

;

;生态修复案例地恢复前后。   受访者供图

;

;我去了一片生态修复的案例地。这里曾经因造桥而成为裸露的荒地，石灰岩、碎屑、碎石遍布。从2006年起，借助自然演替的理论，植物园培育的高山松苗、尼泊尔黄花木、皱叶报春、云南沙棘已渐渐成为先锋植物，“占领”了裸露地表。现在，被风吹来的杨絮也在此落了根，长成杨树。

;

;远处，天葬台的人骨已成碎块，红嘴鸦在松赞林寺盘旋。被人破坏的山野植物慢慢恢复，普通种子在这里生根发芽，岁月漫长。

;

;"Four Weddings and a Funeral"

;

;;

;

;Four Weddings and A Funeral ;;

;

;Unexpectedly, I remembered Andy again. I'm talking about Andie MacDowell, the heroine of Four Weddings and A Funeral. The poet Zhu Zhu once uniquely compared Juliette Binoche to "the first bite of ice cream in spring." Yes, everyone has their own bite of ice cream. The difference is that his ice cream is French, while mine is from the United States.

;

;It is said that "Four Weddings and a Funeral" is the representative of British comedy movies, but the overwhelming joy of it has been almost forgotten. What can't be washed away is Andy's eyes, which look tenderly and lovingly at Hugh Grant, who always looks hasty and clumsy, and at me, who is also hasty and clumsy. She is the kind of person who is very tolerant and restrained, allowing you to make mistakes and holding you lightly in her arms. During the time when I was in my twenties, Andy had been quietly watching my sadness, unobtrusively and undazzlingly, like the simple and strange flower in my youthful dreams.

;

;Later, she was forgotten. Time flies by, the soul is lost, the youthful mood gradually fades, and there are no more dreams at night. As a result, Andy became a coordinate of his youth, precipitated in the light and shadow of time, eroded and lost day by day. When the world of mortals rises, what is left in our hearts? I once read some beautiful short poems and was filled with emotion, so I wrote a quatrain: "After eating, my heart is drowning in the Zen of my pen, and I am disappointed with the dripping of powder and kneading cakes. I was also very fond of it back then, and once wrote about the spring breeze." When spring ice cream Melting little by little, the strange flowers in the dream withered little by little, Andy, none of us can resist the wand of time.

;

;"Since ancient times, beauties are like famous generals, and they are not allowed to grow old in the world." In the blink of an eye, Andy is in his sixties, right? It is no longer easy to find negative photos of her youth online. Audrey Hepburn, Catherine Zeta Jones, Sophie Marceau, Maggie Cheung, Rosamund Kwan, Christy Chung, Zhu Yin... How should they think lovingly of their radiant beauty when they look in the mirror at midnight?

;

;"Seventy Years Back in Time"

;

;;

;

;Somewhere in Time ;;

; < p>; "The flowers bloom in spring, the wind in autumn and the setting sun in winter, I once ignorantly thought so in my melancholy youth." On the university campus in the 1980s and 1990s, there was no other music than Luo Dayou's This song touches our heartstrings even more. I am a person who is quite sensitive to time. When I was a teenager, I would be immersed in her magic and couldn't extricate myself. Later, after seeing the dead end, the legend, the ups and downs, and life and death, I finally understood time. If you can heal everything and carve everything, you are already heading towards the vicissitudes of middle age.

;

;So I have been fanatical about Time Movie for a long time. Because movies are one of the ways to understand time. It has infinite capabilities of hypothesis and expression, and it brings me endless emotion and sadness. A movie that also belongs to youth: "Somewhere in Time" (Somewhere in Time). At the end, when the male protagonist sees today's sun and moon inlaid on the coin, the beauty from seventy years ago instantly moves to that end of time. Falling, how melancholy it is forever and ever, and how terrifying it is! Time-themed movies usually have amazing visual effects, like "Back to the Future", like "Black Hole Frequency", like "The Time Machine", but this one does not. It relies on time itself to create the effect, like a cup of pure Kuding. Tea, without any added flavour.

;

;"The Shawshank Redemption"

;

;;

;

;The Shawshank Redeption

;

;So, what is the taste of time? To me, at least, those black and white video tapes with blurry, pulsing images are one of a kind. After I fell in love with movies, those black and white lights and shadows accompanied me for a long time, day and night, morning and night, like dreams that I couldn't see clearly or remember. "Once Upon a Time in America", "Last Year at Marienba", "Fang Fang", "Red", "Underground", and yes, there is also the one that can never be skipped "The Shawshank Redemption" (The Shawshank Redemption). After watching it dozens of times, I still can't quite explain its charm. Or, any elaboration and explanation are unnecessary. As the Buddhists say, will it become a "textual barrier"? However, there are some sentences that I can still retrieve from the warehouse of my memory at will (thanks to the subtitles of the video version, their Chinese version is no less than Stephen King): "We can't understand what is being sung in it, but it seems to be an angel The sound made the thick stone wall disappear without a trace. At this moment, the prisoners in Shark Castle regained their freedom." "Busy, busy living, or busy dying." "Some birds cannot be shut down because of their wings. It’s so glorious.”

;

;Birds with brilliant wings lingered in my once bleak world. Without their chirping, we would always be prisoners of despair. Staring at the beating black and white light and shadow that night, listening to the "hissing" echo of the video tape, my prison disappeared without a trace, and I came to the moon and stars, savoring the taste of time.

;

;This is a movie. To me, it may mean a way to survive, the wind settles the dust, and the sky brings happiness and auspiciousness.
